intro: Rubus austrotibetanus, commonly known as the Tibetan raspberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Tibet and adjacent areas of China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of small, edible berries. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are trifoliate, with serrated edges, and it produces white to pale pink flowers in the spring. The berries are often used in local cuisines and have potential medicinal properties.
